definition[0]: the past tense and past participle of lead1
definition[1]: having a particular thing as the most important cause or influence
definition[2]: a small electronic object that produces light when an electrical current is sent through it. LEDs are used, for example, as lights on electrical equipment, and to make words and pictures on large screens.
definition[3]: if something is market-led, consumer-led etc, the market etc is the most important influence on the way that it behaves or changes
example[1]: his espousal of aggressive market-led economics
example[2]: The economy will start aconsumer-led recovery by midyear.
example[3]: Social security and other demand-led expenditures placed upward pressure on public spending.
definition[4]: used after the name of a company, organization etc to say that the company etc is leading a particular project or activity
example[4]: a major government-led initiative for large-scale debt cancellation
